tr.td: Jerry Beguelin MD and Esther Schulz DO

representedOrganization.name: Jerry Beguelin MD and Esther Schulz DO

td.content: s:white f aged 50 ys presents via EMS a short time following MVA. she was struck while passing through intersection, and sustained injury to the back of the head (LOC 33 min). Striking vehicle traveling at estimated 20 mph on impact. patient c/o mild vomiting, severe headache, moderate nausea and Traumatic Injury - Blunt. o:Height 66 in, Weight 158 lbs, Temperature 98.2 F, Pulse 72, SystolicBP 113, DiastolicBP 75, Respiration 17, MRI Brain Unremarkable, appears in NAD, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Chest = normal breathing sounds B/L, Neuro: WNL, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex a:TBI (concussion) p:administered Acetaminophen - 650 mg po/pr q 6 hrs PRN pain, performed MRI Brain, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed, and ordered rest, and referred patient to family practice/primary care.

tr.td: Jerry Beguelin MD and Esther Schulz DO

td.content: s:50 yo white female presents for recheck following traumatic incident. she was seen in local EMD for injuries, including a concussion (33 min LOC). she reports doing fine with no problems and denies vomiting, headache and nausea o:Height 66 in, Weight 159 lbs, Temperature 98.2 F, Pulse 72, SystolicBP 114, DiastolicBP 76, Respiration 17, ImPACT test Verbal Memory=98,Visual Memory=96,Processing Speed=46.1,Reaction Time=0.46, HEENT: NCAT, PERRL, Neck: Supple, C/V: RRR, Pulm: CTAB. Good effort, Abd: Scaphoid, soft, ND, NTTP. BS WNL, MS: Extremities x 4 WNL. Strength 5/5, equal bilaterally, Neuro: CN II-XII WNL. No deficits, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex a:S/P Concussion (with loss of consciousness from 31 to 59 minutes). No sequelae p:performed ImPACT test, and performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed.

content2.Unmatched: presents for recheck following traumatic incident

Term.SOAP_SECTION: head, eyes, ears, nose, throat Examination

content2.Unmatched: No deficits , Eyes = normal pupillary reflex
